content.description: Bring your shoes to the library to fit in a quick study break! Climb the right side of the low-angle face, leaning on the arÃªte and using those little pockets however you feel like. Top out, then run around to the staircase and get back to your homework!
content.location: Look directly left just as you are going to climb up the spiral staircase. You can't miss it, and neither can anybody watching from the library.

content.description: See figure for a more illustrative description. Start on the stair ledges and cruise to the outer helix and hit the slopey mono pockets (about one pad deep). Top out. Beware of pedestrians who might step on you.
content.location: By the entrance to Stevenson library

content.description: Always remember to check your pockets before you leave class, who knows what you could have left behind in Stevenson (this route!). Climb up the middle of the face, using the parallel lines of pockets and feet on undulating conglomerate. Some of the pockets disappear into the wall, but they come in pairs, so just reach where you think it is and it will be there! Top out then run back down the stairs to grab your backpack for the next class.
content.location: Same face as Study Break, but following the center two pocket lines up from the ground to the top.

content.description: A lot of science going on in the Stevenson complex consisting of 7 buildings and many miscellaneous structures.
